response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for _sitebuiltins Code with pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document outlines testing strategies to ensure the compatibility and functionality of custom extensions or modifications to the built-in `_sitebuiltins` module using pytest within Python 3.12+.
key_points: Use pytest's monkeypatch feature to temporarily replace built-in functions with test doubles.
Implement test cases for each function and class in the custom extension, ensuring that they behave as expected when called within a regular Python script and within the `_sitebuiltins` module.
Verify that the custom extension does not cause unexpected side effects or conflicts with existing built-in functions.
Use pytest's built-in assertions to check function return values, class methods behavior, and interactions between different components of the custom extension.
Test your custom extension with both Python 3.12+ and earlier versions (if applicable) to ensure backward compatibility.

code_examples.code:
def test_custom_function(monkeypatch):
    monkeypatch.setattr(_sitebuiltins, 'my_func', mock.Mock())
    my_module.my_function()
    # assert that my_mock was called with the expected arguments

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use the latest version of pytest.
Earlier Python versions (before 3.12) may require using an older version of pytest or alternative testing tools.
caveats: Exercise caution when modifying the built-in `_sitebuiltins` module to avoid inadvertently breaking existing functionality or introducing security vulnerabilities.
Ensure that test cases thoroughly exercise all aspects of the custom extension, particularly edge cases and error conditions.
